name: Nadia Polikarpova
content: Nadia Polikarpova home projects team papers teaching activities nadia polikarpova Associate Professor Department of Computer Science and Engineering University of California, San Diego Office: CSE 3102 Email: npolikarpova@ucsd.edu cv | google scholar | github | twitter I am an Associate Professor in the Computer Science and Engineering Department at the University of California, San Diego. I am a member of the Programming Systems group. I am also affiliated with the Hannah Arendt Research Center (HARC). My current research interests are in usable AI-assisted programming (and human-AI collaboration more broadly), civic technology (AI and security for civil society), and computational social science. In the past, I worked on program synthesis, automated verification, and programming languages. I am the Vice Chair for Graduate Education (aka GradCom Chair) in the CSE department. If you are a current CSE PhD student, feel free to email me or schedule an appointment to discuss any issues related to the PhD program or your experience in the department. PROJECTS active and recent: HiLDe: exposing AI decisions to programmers [VL/HCC'25] GPTScientist: a simple Python library for analyzing tabular data using LLMs [code] Solidarity under Repression: a comprehensive study of Russian civil society in 2024 (with HARC) [report] [press coverage] older projects: LEAP: validating AI-generated code with live programming [CHI'24] [code] Snippy: live programming by example in Python [UIST'20] [OOPSLA'21] [video] [demo] [code] Hoogle+: type-driven component-based synthesis for Haskell [POPL'20] [OOPSLA'20] [demo] [source] SuSLik: synthesis of heap-manipulating programs with separation logic [POPL'19] [PLDI'21] [CAV'21] [ICFP'21] [demo] [source] Lifty/STORM: information flow control with refinement types [ICFP'20] [OSDI'21] [demo] ReSyn: Synquid + resource types [PLDI'19] [ICFP'20] [demo] [source] Synquid: program synthesis from refinement types [PLDI'16] [demo] [source] AutoProof: an automated deductive verifier for programs that manipulate complex object structures [readme] [demo] EiffelBase2: a fully verified container library [source] [pdf] Boogaloo: a symbolic execution engine for Boogie [demo] [source] CITADEL: dynamic invariant inference meets Design-by-Contract [readme] TEAM current: Bimal Raj Gyawali Raven Rothkopf Emmanuel Anaya GonzÃ¡lez Eric Mugnier (co-advisor) Timothy Zhou (co-advisor) Saketh Kasibatla (intermittent co-advisor) Cole Kurashige (intermittent co-advisor) alumni: Shraddha Barke (PhD 2024, then Microsoft Research) Zheng (Aaron) Guo (PhD 2024, then postdoc at UMich) Kasra Ferdowsi (PhD 2024, then cubist) Michael James (PhD 2024, then SailPlane) Rose Kunkel Tristan Knoth (PhD 2023, then jitx) Hila Peleg (postdoc, then faculty at Technion) John Sarracino (PhD 2021, then postdoc at Cornell) David Justo (MS 2020) Sourav Anand (MS 2019) PAPERS ChopChop: a Programmable Framework for Semantically Constraining the Output of Language Models, Shaan Nagy, Timothy Zhou, Nadia Polikarpova, Loris D'Antoni POPL'26.
